dialogue.text: The university offers a degree in Applied Uncertainty. Students learn not subjects but how to navigate not knowing.
Your curriculum will emerge from your uncertainties. We teach from what you don't know.
What job will this prepare them for?
All of them. In a rapidly changing world, the ability to navigate uncertainty is the only permanent skill.
Day one: I know less than when I arrived. Success!

psychological_notes: Shows evolution of education to embrace uncertainty as core curriculum. Students learn meta-skills of navigation rather than fixed knowledge. Former Certainty Movement leader now teaches uncertainty. Practical preparation for rapidly changing world through comfort with not-knowing.
philosophical_underpinning: Education as preparation for mystery rather than mastery
